intro: Petrophile carduacea, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical flower spikes that resemble bottlebrushes. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in coastal or dry inland areas. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, pink or red flowers that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. Petrophile carduacea is well adapted to arid environments and can thrive in poor soil conditions.
